Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.description: A viral disease causing upward curling and yellowing of leaves, stunting plant growth.
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.care: Remove infected plants immediately, use virus-free seeds, and control whitefly populations.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.description: Fungal disease seen as yellow patches on upper leaf surfaces and mold on undersides.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.care: Ensure proper spacing, use resistant varieties, and apply organic or chemical fungicides.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.description: Small dark water-soaked lesions on leaves, stems, and fruit caused by bacteria.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.care: Use copper sprays, remove infected parts, and ensure good drainage and air flow.

Tomato_Early_blight.description: Fungal disease causing concentric ring spots on lower leaves.
Tomato_Early_blight.care: Rotate crops, remove old plant debris, and use fungicide treatments during early symptoms.

Tomato_Late_blight.description: Aggressive fungus causing dark, wet lesions on leaves and stems, rapid plant death.
Tomato_Late_blight.care: Destroy affected plants, avoid overhead watering, and apply preventive fungicides early.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Gray circular spots with dark borders on leaves, usually starting from the bottom.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.care: Avoid overhead watering, prune lower leaves, and use fungicides like chlorothalonil.

Tomato__Target_Spot.description: Spots with concentric rings appear on leaves, often mistaken for early blight.
Tomato__Target_Spot.care: Apply fungicides, remove weeds, and maintain crop rotation.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.description: Tiny pests creating webbing and yellow stippling on leaves.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.care: Use miticides or neem oil, increase humidity, and introduce predatory mites.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Virus causing mottling, distortion, and stunted growth.
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.care: Destroy infected plants, disinfect tools, and control aphid or thrip populations.

Tomato__healthy.description: The plant is healthy with no visible symptoms of disease.
Tomato__healthy.care: Maintain regular watering, balanced fertilization, and monitor for early signs of disease.

Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Spots on leaves and fruits, reducing yield and marketability.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.care: Plant resistant varieties, rotate crops, and avoid working with wet plants.

Potato___Early_blight.description: Concentric rings on older leaves, eventually leading to yellowing and drop.
Potato___Early_blight.care: Apply fungicides and ensure proper nutrient supply and irrigation.

Potato___Late_blight.description: Dark brown spots on leaves and stems with white fungal growth underneath.
Potato___Late_blight.care: Use resistant varieties, apply fungicides, and remove infected plants quickly.

Potato___healthy.description: No symptoms of disease or pest infestation. Green, vibrant leaves and strong stems.
Potato___healthy.care: Maintain balanced soil nutrition, rotate crops, and inspect regularly for any abnormalities.
